choices: Break the silence kindly and gently
Break the silence cruelly (terrorize and taunt her)
Break the silence playfully (tease her sadistically)
1.content:
Anna stood and stared at the glimmering, swirling portal before her. On the other side of it contained her prize. On the other side of that portal lie another world, nearly identical to this one, with a few minor differences. The first was that for some reason, Anna's bloodline never came to be, which meant she had no duplicate. The second was that no person in this world exceeded the height of 2 1/2 inches tall. Upon examining this world further, she had found peculiar aspects of it. The tiny people were nearly immune to permanent injury (not to say that they couldn't feel pain) and for some odd reason...she could invade their dreams. Anna found great fun in this, for she had located the tiny duplicate of the girl she had a crush on, and intended to take her as a replacement for the real one. Anna enjoyed tormenting the tiny for many nights before she intended to bring her little prize home with her. Tonight was the last night.
Jourdyn laid back the covers of her bed, crawled inside and pulled the blanket up to her chin. She quietly prayed for a night without the wretched nightmares that had come to plague her. She took one last deep breath before she was plunged into a world of dreams.
         "I'm home!" Jourdyn shouted as she unlocked the door to her house and stepped inside, before instantly stopping in her tracks. There, sitting on the kitchen counter with her legs neatly crossed, was the same brown haired girl from every nightmare. "Who are you?..." Jourdyn asked warily as she stepped a bit closer to the girl. "And how did you get in my house?"
         "Oh, Jourdyn," the girl said in an overly mock hurt tone, "Surprised you don't remember me." She uncrossed her legs and hopped off the counter. Anna had her hands behind her back, concealing something. "Well, maybe I could help jog your memory." Anna produced a large knife from behind her back and shoved it into Jourdyn's torso, yanking it downwards. Jourdyn screamed in agony as a pain worse than fire ripped through her with the cut of the blade.
         "Oh, no..." Jourdyn thought in terror as she saw the girl reach towards the cut in her stomach. The girl tore into the crude cut, retrieving a large, bloody length of Jourdyn's intestine. Anna severed it from the rest and squeezed out the excrement before daintily wrapping it around her neck. As the sadistic girl played with the glistening organ, Jourdyn desperately tried to stop her bleeding and put the organs back into her chest.
         "Look at me! Look at me! Isn't my new scarf sooo pretty?!" Anna asked giddily, skipping around the terrified girl.
         "Go away...Go away...Please..." Jourdyn silently begged her tormentor as the world around them began to melt. The girl's demeanor changed from "playfully dark" to "out for blood".
She ran and tackled Jourdyn, although lighter and shorter, she was much stronger than her red-haired counterpart. Anna locked eyes with her prey, her cruel chocolate brown eyes threatening Jourdyn's peaceful gray eyes.
         "You. Will. Be. MINE!" Anna hissed before vanishing into thin air, nothing left of her presence but discarded organs and puddles of blood. Jourdyn gasped and sat up in bed, sweat drenching her pajamas and dark rings forming around her eyes. She looked at her alarm clock: 2 a.m. She wouldn't sleep for the rest of the night.
Back in her room, Anna awoke gently from her slumber, having enjoyed her toy's torment to its full potential. It was eight in the morning, time for school. However, she wasn't attending it today. Today she would enter the portal and retrieve her new pet. Anna got dressed in a white t-shirt and gray hoodie with blue skinny jeans and brown boots with a wedge heel.
She gingerly stepped into the portal of swirling light...
         "Hey, Jourdyn!" a girl shouted.
         "Huh?!" Jourdyn bolted upright and fearfully looked around. "Oh...Oh, it's you, Marissa. Yeah?…What do you need?" Jourdyn asked as she tried to steady her rapid heart.
         "Hey, are you okay? You look a little...under the weather." Marissa said.
         "Yeah, yeah...I'm fine, I've...just been..." Jourdyn trailed off as she gazed out the window. Her eyes widened in horror as she recognized what she was seeing. An enormous girl was headed straight for the school...the same girl from her nightmares. Jourdyn let out a blood curdling shriek of terror as a giant fist collided with the window, showering several students with bits of pulverized glass. The huge hand snaked its way into the room before firmly grasping Jourdyn by the legs, dragging her out of the school kicking and screaming. "Help me! HELP ME! PLEASE! DON'T LET ME DIE!" Jourdyn howled as she was forcibly pulled into the giant's fist. After her little prize had been collected, the giantess turned and left as quickly as she came.
Anna smirked and laughed inwardly as she rampaged through the tiny world on the way back to the portal. She had gotten what she came for, there was no reason to stick around any longer. Anna quickly stepped through the portal and landed in her bedroom, sealing the portal shut so her new toy would have no chance of escape. She quietly removed her boots, the soles and tread caked with flattened bodies of the citizens of the other world. Anna opened her fist and spotted the tiny girl curled into a ball, her knees against her chest and her arms splayed against her head, seemingly whispering and whimpering cries for mercy. Anna silently dropped her new pet into a glass on her nightstand and began to consider the many ways she could break the silence.
1.title: The Start of a Living Hell

choices: Fuck dream sequences, let's get back to the action.
11.content:
Anna smiled brightly, hoping to cheer up the tiny trapped in the glass. No such luck. Anna fully knew why. Her bit of "fun" during those nightmares combined with the sleep deprivation and what Jourdyn had experienced earlier would really take a toll on anyone. Jourdyn sat in the glass with her knees to her chest, her head buried in her crossed arms. She was sobbing in fear, she knew that for whatever reason she was here, it wasn't good. She lifted up her head and looked her captor in the eyes, mascara streaking her cheeks in black rivulets.
         "Wh-what do you want from me?..." She whispered so quietly she wasn't sure the giant had heard her. "P-please don't hurt me..." she added.
         "I won't," the giantess assured her. "Jourdyn."
Jourdyn sat there in shock, her already tense body had locked into place and she began to hyperventilate.
         "Wh-WHAT did you say?!" Jourdyn hissed through panicked breaths.
         "I said, 'I won't, Jourdyn.'" the giantess repeated herself.
         "Ah...Ah!" Jourdyn began to scream and cry. "Oh, no, no, no, no, no!"
         "What is it? What's wrong?" Anna asked gently.
         "Y-you..." Jourdyn croaked. "Wh-who ARE you?! How do you...How do you know who I am?!"
         "I know a lot of things, Jourdyn." Anna replied casually. "One day, I noticed you, and from that moment onward, I knew that you would be PERFECT." Anna had a strange sort of sparkle in her eyes now.
         "P-perfect for...what?" Jourdyn asked, still unsure if she really wanted to know the answer.
         "Why, isn't it obvious? YOU are going to be my pet. The minute I set my eyes on you, I KNEW. I KNEW that you were the one. I KNEW that no one else would do. I HAD to have you. And so...here you are."
         "B-but...but...You can't do this to me!" Jourdyn protested. "I'm a human being!"
         "Oh..." Anna began to laugh and shook her head condescendingly. "No...no, you're not."
         "Wh-what?!" Jourdyn stuttered. Her head was reeling, this was all too much to take in. Disturbing nightmares that left her sleepless for weeks, being captured by a giantess who ripped her away from her home, the giant girl being aware of who Jourdyn was, being told she was going to be made into a pet, and now being told she wasn't human. Jourdyn was beginning to hope that this was just another dream. "N-no! Not true, not true, not TRUE!" she screamed.
         "Well, believe what you want. But, you'll never leave me. You'll be mine for the rest of your life."
         "N-no...Please..." Jourdyn whimpered.
         "Oh, don't worry. I'll take good care of you. I'll feed you, bathe you, maybe even...pleasure you a little. Maybe if you're really good..."
Jourdyn was terrified. She couldn't escape this captivity, and the prospect of being naked in front of this beast sickened her.
         "N-no..." Jourdyn tightly shut her eyes and balled her fists. Hot tears poured from her eyes as she waited for the nightmare world to disappear. She beat her fists against her temples and screamed when she realized that this world was all too real. "No, no, no, no, NO!" Jourdyn collapsed in a heap, weakened, her tears staining her clothes.
         "Shhh...It'll be okay." Anna gently stroked Jourdyn on the back. Picking up Jourdyn by her sides, taking care not to hurt her, Anna carefully brought her over to a cage made of wire, presumably meant for hamsters. She had meticulously covered the bottom in several thick pieces of cloth for Jourdyn's comfort. "See what I did, Jourdyn? It's all for you." Anna quietly opened the door and gently placed her new pet inside. "Rest now. You've been through a lot."
         Jourdyn begrudgingly agreed with her captor. She watched sadly as the door to her prison was closed and latched with a hook from the outside, guaranteeing someone of her strength wouldn't be able to escape. Well, she thought, at least it wasn't locked. Jourdyn patted down the blankets covering the bottom of the cage and slipped off her shoes. She laid down and grabbed a loose cloth from the side to cover herself with, and gratefully began to drift to sleep, hoping that she could have a pleasant dream for once.
11.title: Break the silence kindly and gently

112.content:
Jourdyn opened her eyes, once again lying in her soft bed. It had all been a dream. A terrible, awful, realistic nightmare, but a dream nonetheless. Jourdyn stretched, wiping her eyes of sleep as she thought about what she had seen. Reflecting back on it, though it was one of the most terrifying and twisted things she could ever think of, she thought it to be rather silly now. A most likely cannibalistic giant from another realm of existence making pets out of her kind? Ridiculous. Horrifying and chilling, but ridiculous. Jourdyn began to laugh as she thought harder about it, slightly wondering why her heart was beating so fast. Jourdyn placed her feet on the floor and stood, the carpet soft to the touch. She walked towards the door and upon grabbing the handle, laughed a bit forcefully as she tried to steady her rapid heartbeat. Jourdyn walked across the hall to the bathroom and stood in front of the mirror. She combed her fingers through her frazzled hair then smiled wide, trying desperately to shake the uneasiness in her stomach that seemed oh so out of place. Suddenly there was a clattering of dishes in the kitchen below. Jourdyn jumped back, then took a deep breath. Why was she like this?! It was just a stupid dream! Jourdyn took a deep breath and tried to steady herself.
          "Mom?" Jourdyn called out. Receiving no response, Jourdyn quietly made her way down the stairs. "M-Mom? Dad? Is that you?" She called again, slightly more unnerved than the last time. "C'mon, this isn't funny anymore!" Jourdyn entered the kitchen, unprepared for what she would see. Her home in a state of complete and utter ruin, her mother and father nowhere to be seen. Dishes piled and stacked high in the sink, crusted with god knows how old food, crawling with writhing, squirming maggots. Flies buzzed as swarms of beetle collected in various spots on the grime coated floor, the trash bin filled with a disgusting substance that reeked, so far into a state of rot that it could have been poured on the grass and called compost. Jourdyn pulled her shirt up over her nose and coughed, trying not to gag as she continued to trek through the house. She turned towards the window, staring at the unkempt grass, shriveled and brown. What had happened here?
         "Jourdyn?" A faint voice, no more than a whisper on the wind came forward.
         "M-Mom? Is that you?" Jourdyn asked as she quickly ran towards her parents' bedroom, narrowly avoiding cobwebs, spiders' webs, and piles of mildew covered, moth hole infested clothing. Jourdyn gagged and retched when she reached the door of her parents' room, overcome by the overpowering stench of rotten flesh. Summoning her courage, Jourdyn grabbed the dusty handle and turned it, forcing open the rickety door covered in chipped and peeling paint. Nothing in the entire world could have prepared her for what she was about to see. Her parents, laid side by side, holding hands. Both of them dead and mummified. Half of her father's face was missing, the revealed skull browned to a caramel color upon being exposed to the elements. His eyes were missing. A large black beetle scurried out of his left eye socket and into his right. Upon closer inspection Jourdyn discovered a pile of writhing maggots nested in his head. His chest was ripped open, as if someone had decided to cut away the flesh from his torso to look at the human anatomy firsthand. All of his organs lay untouched in his chest, a thick layer of dust coating them and the bones, save for the odd glistening as if they had been covered in jelly. Her mother... Oh, her mother... Her mother had been skinned, her whole body, save for her face. Decaying muscles and ligaments prominent. Blood crusted and caked every inch of her. Her hair lay around her in thick, greasy strands. Her mouth had been stretched and sewn into a macabre smile, showing every single yellow and brown cracked tooth. Her empty, lifeless eyes screamed of horrors no human being should ever witness, but she had to face. Jourdyn covered her mouth with her hands, then turned around and vomited onto the floor. "M-Mommy... D-Daddy... Wh-who..." She stuttered as she continued to stare. Jourdyn's horrified expression turned to one of blatant insanity as she broke out into an ear to ear grin, climbing up and laying down on the dust caked bed, betwixt her decaying parents. "Good night, Mom. Good night, Dad." Jourdyn beamed as she nestled herself in their corpses before she broke out into a weeping mess, deep sobs wracking her every nerve.
          Jourdyn snapped her eyes open as tears flowed freely from her eyes. At the moment she wasn't certain what was going on or where she was, all she was certain of were the awful, cruel memories of her dream. Jourdyn slammed her back against the cage's cold metal bars as she sobbed and screamed. She didn't want to be here, trapped like a helpless, delicate butterfly. She wanted to be with her family, with her friends, in a world where everything was her size and everything made sense.
         She wanted to go home.
112.title: Jourdyn has a sad dream.

113.content:
Jourdyn awoke, surrounded by wrecked city. Enormous craters decimated the streets, buildings and power lines alike had fallen. Smoke rose from the aftermath in great black billowing clouds. One word went through Jourdyn's mind as she surveyed the destruction. "Armageddon". She slowly got to her feet, her clothing ripped in patches. What could have done this? Jourdyn decided it would be best to find someone in this hellish world and began to search.
         "Hello? Is anyone here?" Jourdyn called out as she walked along the cracked pavement. In the distance, in front of a burning building, she spotted a group of people huddled together. Jourdyn gasped in hopefulness and ran towards them. "Oh, thank god I found you! I just woke up and I-" Jourdyn touched one of the people on the shoulder and turned them around. "... Mom?!" Jourdyn shouted in surprise. A younger blonde girl stood next to her. "Hayley?!" Jourdyn cried at her eleven year old sister. "What are you doing here?!"
         "We're searching for refuge, sweetie." Jourdyn's "mother" replied in monotone.
         "Refuge? But... But I-I was... You ABANDONED ME in the middle of the road, how could you?!" Jourdyn screamed. "Refuge?! Am I not good enough to be saved?!" Jourdyn cried in frustration.
         "No. I would have saved you... But I can't touch you now." Jourdyn's mother replied in the same monotonous voice.
         "What do you mean?! Why?!" Jourdyn asked.
         "I'm not allowed to interfere with her decisions." The unemotional voice of one of her loved ones was enough to drive Jourdyn mad.
         "Hiya!" Jourdyn jumped nearly a foot in the air as a sweet girl's voice sounded behind her, two pale, slender arms wrapping around her waist. "Hey there! You looked a little confused so I decided to come and introduce myself!" The girl released Jourdyn's waist and faced her. Jourdyn's jaw dropped in shock, her mouth moving as she tried to find words but none came.
         "Y-you... Y-you're..." Jourdyn struggled to communicate.
         "Do you not remember me? Of all people?! Ooh, do you have amnesia?!" the girl asked with genuine curiosity.
         "I-I..." Jourdyn stammered.
         "Okay! I'll help! This is your mom!" The girl pointed to Jourdyn's mother. "This is your sister!" The girl pointed to Hayley. Jourdyn took this time to note that the girl seemed to be the only one... Alive. The rest were standing around, not talking, with glazed over, dead eyed stares. "And me?" The girl pointed to herself, then approached the rigid Jourdyn. "Well, I'm your best friend." The girl stated this in a serious tone as she wrapped an arm around Jourdyn's shoulders. "So don't ever forget that."
         "Wh-what's your name?" Jourdyn asked.
         "Oh!" The girl playfully slapped her head. "I forgot to tell you who I am! Well... I'm Anna."
          "Y-you... It-It's you... G-get away from me!" Jourdyn screamed in horror and revulsion.
         "I can't go away now! Besides..." Anna faced Jourdyn and placed her hands on Jourdyn's shoulders. Her face began to morph into a monstrous form. Her cheeks jaggedly split, as though someone had cut them then tore the skin to give her a disgusting permanent smile. Her teeth sharpened to points, new ones growing to accommodate her now nightmarish mouth. Blood dribbled from her cheeks down those horrible pearl colored things. She fearlessly reached up her hand and ever so delicately plucked out an eye, an otherworldly blue glow filling the empty socket. She repeated the process, this time opting to leave her plucked eyeball hanging halfway down her cheek, connected only by a few bloody tendrils of muscle. A slobbering, black, forked tongue slithered out from her mouth and drooled as this abomination gazed at the screaming Jourdyn, her claws digging into her back. "You'll always be mine, little Jourdyn."
         "No, no... Please, please, please, please, please... Don't do this to me... Please... Please..." Jourdyn begged, weeping, so taken aback by this monstrosity that she could only pitifully plea for mercy over, and over, and over. She was finally silenced to a whimper when the monster shoved her tongue down Jourdyn's throat for a moment in a farce of a kiss.
         "Shhh... You should sleep now." The creature told Jourdyn as she sat on the pavement, forcibly taking Jourdyn down with her and cradling her head. "It'll be okay, just to to sleep." Anna's tongue snaked out of her mouth and lapped at Jourdyn's face, leaving a trail of glistening saliva. Jourdyn sobbed helplessly as demented and psychotic laughter issued forth from this... Thing, surrounding her and resonating in her ears. She felt as if she would go insane herself if she continued to listen. The monster began to sing. "Hush-a-bye, don't you cry, oh you pretty little baby..." Jourdyn didn't want to listen, she just wanted to be free of all the madness. But the song was so soothing... Her eyes began to close as she felt the thing's claws in her back and teeth on her neck...
         Jourdyn's eyes snapped open as she resisted the urge to scream. She quickly sat up and wiped drool off the corner of her mouth. She leaned against the side of the cage and tried to steady her breathing.
         "There's no psychotic monster girl." Jourdyn whispered to herself. "There's just... A giant girl who has unknown intentions for me..." With that statement, Jourdyn buried her head in her knees and began to cry.
113.title: Jourdyn has a nightmare.

1131.content:
Anna woke up and stretched as her eyes fluttered open. She had a wonderful dream that she had confessed her love to Jourdyn and discovered that it was a mutual feeling. After that they had begun to get close and had even had sex. The last thing Anna remembered was being snuggled up next to Jourdyn, kissing her softly. Anna was disappointed to find that it was merely a dream, but comforted by the thought that she had a tiny replacement. Anna approached the doll sized girl seated in the cage and smiled warmly. She would take care of this one forever. Anna's heart melted as she looked at the adorable girl the size of a mouse, but was overcome with an odd emotion once she saw the girl's red puffy eyes, disheveled hair, and tear stained cheeks and clothes. It wasn't remorse exactly, yet it made her feel sick, starting in her stomach and heart and slowly spreading through her body. It took all of her willpower not to rip open the cage door, grab Jourdyn in her hand, and cradle and rock her until she calmed down, with Anna cooing that everything would be alright. She tapped gently on the cage, causing the frightened girl to recoil in horror.
         "Hey... It'll be okay, I'm not gonna hurt you." Anna whispered. Jourdyn only whimpered in response. Anna opened the cage door and reached inside, wrapping her hand around Jourdyn's frail, trembling form. As Anna pulled out her hand with Jourdyn in tow, Jourdyn began to scream in blood curdling fear. Jourdyn thrashed against the warm flesh of the retracting fist, her socked feet colliding futilely with the giantess' bony fingers.
         "No, no, no, no, no!" Jourdyn cried, fresh tears pouring from her eyes as she jerked her body, trying desperately to get out of the giant's grasp. "Let me out of here, LEMME OUT OF HERE!"
         "Shhh... It'll be alright, I won't hurt you." Anna cooed, tightening her grip around the girl ever so gently. Anna carefully stroked Jourdyn's hair with her thumb as she finally drew her hand from the cage, closing its door and turning away. "What's the matter? You can tell me." Anna asked as she cradled the frightened girl in her palm. Jourdyn let out a strangled sob as she shook her head, her lips struggling to form words.
         "M-monster... Y-you... Y-you're... Y-you're a... M-m... No..." Jourdyn sobbed. "I-I can't... I can't say..."
         "Oh... That's okay. You don't have to tell me if you really don't want to." Anna replied. "Come on, let's get you cleaned up. Afterwards, I'll get you something to eat, okay?"
         "Okay..." Jourdyn whimpered as the giantess made her way to the bathroom across the hall. Anna turned on the tap water and waited for it to get hot. When it was suitable, she closed the drain and allowed the warm water to fill the sink. While she was waiting, she set Jourdyn down on the side of the sink and looked at her expectantly.
         "Get undressed." Anna told her.
         "P-please don't look at me..." Jourdyn asked. Her mind relentlessly mocked her for making such a request, as it was obvious that regardless of what Jourdyn asked, the giantess was going to do as she pleased. Jourdyn was a bit shocked when the giantess respected her wishes and covered her eyes. Jourdyn quickly removed her socks, pulled down her pants, and took off her shirt. She unclasped her bra and hesitantly slipped out of of her panties. Jourdyn tentatively stuck one foot in the water before lowering her entire body in, the water's heat a welcome substitute to the frigid morning air.
         "You in yet?" Anna asked.
         "Y-yeah." Jourdyn replied as she absentmindedly kicked her feet in the water, feeling its warmth slowly melt away her anxieties about the situation. She was snapped out of her trance by a small splash in the water next to her. It was a piece of soap meant for her to wash with. She grabbed the bar and rubbed it in her hands, massaging her body with her hands as she covered herself in sweet scented suds.
         "So..." Anna began, attempting to make conversation to be rid of the maddening silence, "You slept in your bra?" Anna asked, taking notice of the small pile of clothes on the edge of the sink. "Must've hurt."
         "Y-yeah... It did." Jourdyn replied as she set the soap down and began to wash it off of her skin. "But... When your day consisted of being kidnapped by a giant that's at least thirty times your size and being told that you're now their pet, it's sort of the last thing you'd think about."
         "Oh... Yeah..." Anna guiltily looked at the ground. "Well... I'll try to make your life okay here..."
         "Wh-why here?" Jourdyn asked. "Why can't you just let me go?"
         "Because..." Anna responded.
         "Look, if-if this is a matter of whether or not I'll tell people about your existence, leading to a huge manhunt for you, I won't tell anybody, I swear!"
         "That's not it. That's not why." Anna replied.
         "Then what is it?!" Jourdyn demanded in desperation.
         "IT'S BECAUSE THE WAY I GOT YOU IS GONE!" Anna shouted, leaving herself and Jourdyn staring at each other in silence. Jourdyn's brow furrowed in confusion.
         "What?"
         "Yeah. The way I got you? Big swirly portal thing? It's GONE. Sealed forever. I can never open it AGAIN."
         "I... I don't..." Jourdyn stammered as she closed her eyes and began to cry.
         "Hey... Don't cry... I'll make it okay..." Anna cooed.
         "No! No you won't!" Jourdyn shouted in frustration. "I'll never see anyone I care about again!"
         "You have me!" Anna objected.
         "... What?" Jourdyn asked.
         "I said, 'you have me'." Anna repeated. "You may not care about me, but I certainly care about you."
         "You're a liar! If you really cared, you wouldn't have brought me here in the first place!" Jourdyn screamed.
         "Which was a lapse in my judgement! If I could change it, I would! But I can't reverse what's already happened!"
         "I... I..." Jourdyn stammered.
         "Jourdyn... What's done is done. I'll try to make your life the best that I can, alright? But..." Anna trailed off.
         "But?" Jourdyn asked.
         "But you've got to let me." Anna replied. Jourdyn sniffled and wiped at her right eye, tears being replaced by warm water. Jourdyn swallowed hard and took a deep breath.
         "S-so there's really no way?" Jourdyn asked, her voice slightly wavering.
         "No. I'm sorry..." Anna answered, sounding genuinely apologetic.
         "Oh..." Jourdyn responded as she lifted herself onto the cold porcelain, "What do we do now?"
         "Well..." Anna replied, grabbing a dry rag off the counter to wrap Jourdyn in, "If you're hungry we could go get some food, but if you're still tired we could go back to bed..." As Jourdyn rubbed the soft rag along her body she considered her options. She was quite hungry, as her stomach let out an audible growl, but she also hadn't gotten much sleep the night before...
1131.title: The next morning...

choices: Jourdyn begs to be let out
Anna decides to use her new slave girl
12.content:
Anna grinned with sadistic satisfaction. She hungrily licked her plush lips as she stared at the pathetic bug that had once most likely referred to herself as a human being. Anna took great pleasure dwelling on the thought of Jourdyn's blood curdling terror and reality shattering realizations upon the events that had transpired today. The girl was probably scared out of her wits, moments from having a mental break. If she didn't, Anna was going to make her break.
         "Well hello there, you disgusting little bug." Anna snarled at Jourdyn, gripping the glass prison so tightly it threatened to shatter in her hand. Jourdyn's head bolted upward, her eyes wild with terror, her eyes transfixed on the cruel brown eyes of her tormentor. She couldn't break the stare no matter how hard she tried, tears slipping down her already slick cheeks. She felt her mouth open as a scream issued forth, one like she had never done before. This scream was a blood curdling, ear piercing scream of terror. Her heart beat faster and faster as what she was seeing sunk into her memory. Her breathing quickened as she scrambled backwards to the edge of the glass, her fists beating furiously and even beginning to bleed as she desperately tried to escape from what she assumed would be the earthly equivalent of Hell.
         "P-please don't hurt me. P-please, please, please, please, please, please, please, please." Jourdyn begged. Anna's brow furrowed in confusion for a moment. She could here this tiny thing even when she was speaking at her quietest. Anna merely looked to her right and chalked it up to one of the race's traits.
          "Oh, don't worry, I won't hurt you." Anna replied.
         "Th-thank you..." Jourdyn whispered gratefully.
         "... Much." Anna finished, her ear to ear grin flashing Jourdyn a dangerous view of Anna's sharp white teeth. Jourdyn's breathing deepened, becoming even more panicked as she began to slam her entire body against the glass, hopelessly struggling to just get away from this twist of fate.
         "No, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no...." Jourdyn cried out through sobs. Anna did not reply, she merely laughed uproariously.
         "Now..." Anna plucked Jourdyn from the glass by her wrists as Jourdyn kicked, screamed, and cried. She held Jourdyn in front of her face. "You shall never address me by name. Ever.
